title: Data Monetization Strategy: Creating Value Through Data
description:
[

Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

Data, and the value it supplies, has become an invaluable business asset in today’s digital economy. Data monetization — converting data and analytics into financial gain — is now a crucial source of economic value for organizations across the globe.1

Explore how your organization can realize the full and future value of its data assets in the Data Monetization Strategy: Creating Value Through Data online short course from the MIT Sloan School of Management. Guided by renowned Faculty Director Dr. Barbara Wixom, you’ll learn to identify opportunities to create value from data to generate financial returns, drive process improvements, and leverage data-based insights to enrich products. In six weeks, you’ll gain a comprehensive understanding of data monetization using CISR-developed frameworks to empower you and your teams to strategically maximize value creation through data.

1MIT CISR (Nov, 2019).

,

Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

,

Guided by renowned Faculty Director Dr. Barbara Wixom, you’ll learn to identify opportunities to create value from data to generate financial returns, drive process improvements, and leverage data-based insights to enrich products. In six weeks, you’ll gain a comprehensive understanding of data monetization using CISR-developed frameworks to empower you and your teams to strategically maximize value creation through data.

,

target_students: The growing importance of data as a primary driver of business strategy, requires that data-driven business leaders elevate data and analytics strategies to advance a new vision of business problem-solving| This course is relevant to data-driven business leaders and analytics leaders intent on creating economic value from organizational data| People in these roles may include, but are not limited to, chief data officers, chief information officers, chief technology officers, and chief analytics officers| Technology, data, and information managers, not to mention non-tech leaders and business directors, will elevate any existing knowledge and benefit from the practical frameworks unpacked in the course|
instructor|1|designation: Principal Research Scientist, MIT Center for Information Systems Research

review|1|review: Who knew data analysis could be so interesting? I feel so privileged to have taken part in the UCT Data Analysis online short course and learned more than I could have thought possible in just a few weeks. The online learning experience was organised and well-structured. I always knew that the Tutor, support team, and fellow classmates were there to help if needed. This course made me super excited for a lifetime of skills development and learning, and I cannot wait to apply my new-found analysis skills in the working context. Thank you, GetSmarter!

title: Digital Marketing Analytics
description:
[

Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

Digital technologies have reshaped marketing, leading to a drastic shift in the quality and quantity of information we can store, access, and analyze. This proliferation of data allows businesses to better understand and react to consumer patterns. However, it also increases the need to evolve measurement, planning, and implementation of their marketing activity. Companies require skilled professionals who are equipped to ensure optimal return on investment (ROI) for marketing spend, and to deliver valuable insights that drive better customer service.

The MIT Sloan Digital Marketing Analytics online short course unpacks how to leverage measurement and analysis within your digital marketing strategy. With a focus on analytics-based marketing, you will assess the latest applications of artificial intelligence, machine learning, and predictive modeling that will help drive ROI for campaigns.

,

Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

,

title: Data Analysis
description:
[

Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)

With more and more businesses relying on statistical analysis to drive decision-making, the ability to extract meaning from data has become a highly valued skill. Data analysts play a key role in helping business leaders make informed choices, distinguish between effective and ineffective practices, cut costs, and solve key problems – they are, therefore, an integral part of any successful organisational team.

The Data Analysis online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) will introduce you to the fundamentals of data analysis and the broader potential of analytics in business. Over the course of eight modules, you’ll learn how data is collected, stored, organised, analysed, and interpreted, and you’ll be given the chance to practice data analysis techniques on real-world data sets. Ultimately, you’ll walk away with practical skills that you can apply immediately in your organisation to address specific business needs in the areas of finance, sales, marketing, operational management, and human resource management.

,

Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)

]

review|1|review: My experience with the course was great. As a data scientist, I know a lot of the technical aspects, but this course touched on the application. It showed me how a data science team can fit in with an organization to provide maximum success. Reading other's experiences in the forum also introduced me to ideas, problems, and successes that I have not personally experienced, but now I can use that experience to transfer the benefits of their expertise but not copy their mistakes.

title: Data Science with Python
description:
[

Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)

In a world that’s increasingly data-driven, organisations need professionals who can extract meaningful insights from data to make better business decisions.

On the Data Science with Python online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT), you’ll have the opportunity to develop practical data science and analysis skills for use in everyday business scenarios. Over the course of eight weeks, you’ll cover widely applicable Python libraries and learn how these methods can be, and are, used in day-to-day business situations.

Gain an introduction into statistical learning, which will provide a foundation on the mechanics of machine learning. You’ll explore supervised learning using tree-based models and neural networks, as well as unsupervised learning using K-means and hierarchical clustering. You’ll also learn about the process of revealing more robust patterns to ensure models are useful.

,

Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)

title: Business Analytics
description:
[

Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)

The transformative power of data and analytics has never been more important than it is today. Companies increasingly need to deliver insights on customer experience and business trends in order to remain competitive in the market.

The Business Analytics online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) aims to equip you with advanced data analysis techniques to support business decision-making and critical thinking in times of ambiguity and uncertainty.

This course focuses on practical business application by showing you how to harness data visualisation and storytelling to interpret number sets, identify patterns, and uncover business trends critical to driving growth in your organisation.

By practically engaging with various analytical tools (such as SQL and Tableau, as well as Python on an introductory level), this course will empower you to tap into the power of business intelligence to transform your data and deliver actionable insights.

,

title: Data Analysis for Management
description:
[

Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)

As the world becomes more data driven, future-focused leaders need to develop the quantitative skills to inform corporate decision-making and managerial strategy. Guided by experts from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE), this online certificate course empowers you with the knowledge and practical tools to understand, interpret, and communicate data relevant to your role and organisation.

Develop an understanding of how data-driven models can improve your ability to make decisions in a fast-paced world. Over the course of eight weeks, you’ll participate in a capstone project and apply the techniques and concepts covered to extract business insights from a real data set. You’ll also gain experience using Tableau – a leading business intelligence and data analytics software – to visualise and report on insights extracted from data sets.

,

Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)

,

,

You’ll also gain experience using Tableau – a leading business intelligence and data analytics software – to visualise and report on insights extracted from data sets.

This LSE course will equip managers and data analysts in any industry with the skills to make data-driven decisions for competitive advantage| There are no formal prerequisites for this course, but some numerical literacy is advantageous, as well as a basic working knowledge of Microsoft Excel| You’ll be granted a student licence to download and use Tableau free of charge, for the duration of the course|


This Data Analysis for Management course is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies|

title: Data Analysis and Visualization
description:
[

Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)

As the increase in data changes the way in which organizations operate, professionals with a hybrid blend of analytical skills and domain-specific expertise are required to propel data-driven business decisions. In the Rice University Data Analysis and Visualization online short course, you’ll develop the skills and knowledge to effectively analyze, visualize and communicate data insights within your organization.

Guided by industry experts, you’ll discover how to navigate technical tools such as Tableau, SQL, and VBA. Learn to harness the fundamentals of data analysis such as advanced Excel functions, databases, and practical statistics. Through data-driven insights and effective visualization techniques, you’ll learn to communicate effectively with stakeholders through data storytelling.

,

title: Data Science in Real Estate
description:
[

Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

Thanks to machine learning and data analytics, real estate professionals and investors are now able to make more accurate property assessments than ever before. This Data Science in Real Estate online short course from the MIT School of Architecture and Planning (MIT SA+P) focuses on growing your data science skills within the context of the built environment. During the program, esteemed MIT faculty and industry experts will teach you how to harness statistical techniques to reveal key insights into the factors that impact property investment and development opportunities.

Over the course of six weeks, you’ll learn how to evaluate and tidy data, expand data sets, and generate a selection of models that can be used to explain industry trends and forecast real estate values.

,

Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

,

This Data Science in Real Estate online short course from the MIT School of Architecture and Planning (MIT SA+P) focuses on growing your data science skills within the context of the built environment. During the program, esteemed MIT faculty and industry experts will teach you how to harness statistical techniques to reveal key insights into the factors that impact property investment and development opportunities.

,

Over the course of six weeks, you’ll learn how to evaluate and tidy data, expand data sets, and generate a selection of models that can be used to explain industry trends and forecast real estate values.

title: Sport Management
description:
[

Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)

The global sports market is expected to reach over $556.1 billion in value by 2023.1 In 2019, the North American sector accounted for an estimated 35% of the market.2 Particular opportunities for growth include participatory sports, merchandising and ticketing, and the rapidly emerging eSports industry.

This eight-week Sport Management online short course from the George Washington School of Business will introduce you to the fundamentals of modern sport management and uncover how to identify and leverage opportunities across the industry.

Throughout the course, you’ll gain in-depth insights from faculty experts, helping you to develop the essential skills needed to establish a successful business or managerial career in the sports industry.

1 The Business Research Company (Apr, 2020).

2 The Business Research Company (Apr, 2020).

,

,

,

This eight-week Sport Management online short course from the George Washington School of Business will introduce you to the fundamentals of modern sport management and uncover how to identify and leverage opportunities across the industry.

target_students: This course is designed to support all professionals working or aspiring to work in the sports industry| The content of this course will suit you if you’re involved in organizing sports events, facility management, sports marketing and sponsorship, athlete representation, sports analytics, and sports media and merchandise| It will also be useful to you if you’re a sports coach, fitness professional, lifestyle or nutrition expert| If you’re an aspiring sports entrepreneur or start-up owner looking to leverage your sports industry knowledge to start your own venture, this course will provide practical business skills to synergize your experience with real-world business solutions| If you’re an experienced professional or business leader you will benefit from the emphasis on strategy and good governance, and the development of a practical toolkit for driving your organization towards success, both on the field and in the boardroom| If you’re looking to transition into the sports industry, this course offers clear ideas and frameworks for strategic upskilling, as well as access to up-to-date subject matter, respected faculty members and an engaging learning environment

title: Product Marketing: Research, Consumer Behavior and Analytics
description:
[

Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

As the business landscape evolves, establishing a customer-centric organization has become increasingly important to ensuring success. But, in order to do this, companies need professionals with the skills to turn the insights they gain from the immense volumes of consumer data available today into actions.

Gain the enhanced skills needed to understand customer expectations to improve decision-making in your organization in the Product Marketing: Research, Consumer Behavior and Analytics online short course from Medill at Northwestern University. Over six weeks, you will examine consumer buying habits and discover the underlying motivations that influence their relationship with a brand. You will also learn how to use exploratory, descriptive and predictive analytics to identify, target and engage customers to create more personalized product and service offerings. At the end of the course, you will walk away with the tools and techniques required to draw actionable insights from market research data, and develop a successful product strategy that will help drive business growth.

,

target_students: This course is designed to empower professionals across a variety of business functions with innovative techniques to turn consumer data into business insights that will help drive success| Individuals currently in a product marketing or market research role will hone and update their skills to improve performance in their role| Those with some experience working with market research and consumer data, and who are looking to make a career change into product marketing, will benefit from this course| Executives and leaders of small businesses that do not necessarily have a product marketing department and need to enhance their understanding of what drives their customer to inform their product strategy will also find value in this course|

title: Management Analytics: Decision-Making Lessons From the Sports Industry
description:
[

Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

As the amount of data in the world grows, so does the demand for skilled executives who are equipped with the knowledge to lead a data-driven organization. This program aims to teach managers and executives the strategic, technical, and managerial skills to integrate data analytics into an organization. Drawing on case studies from the sports industry, which has led the way in performance analytics, you’ll learn how to use data in your organization for improved decision making, goal setting, selection of appropriate technologies, structuring of teams, and communication. Guided by MIT faculty and industry thought leaders, this program helps you navigate the process of data transformation in your business or organization, from concept to implementation.

,

Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

,

Guided by MIT faculty and industry thought leaders, this program helps you navigate the process of data transformation in your business or organization, from concept to implementation.

]

title: Data Science Essentials
description:
[

Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

Big data has transformed, and continues to transform, the global business environment, with data scientists and analysts becoming prized assets within organizations. There’s now a need for managers and working professionals to understand the principles and value of data science, and use this to inform business decisions, and recruit and retain the right talent to drive change.1

With insights from the UC Berkeley School of Information (I School), the Data Science Essentials online short course aims to equip you with the fundamentals of data science and the requirements for learning from big data. You’ll learn the foundations of data science for business, allowing you to articulate the value this implementation can bring, and apply it for success.

1 Forbes (Oct, 2018).

,

Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

,

There’s now a need for managers and working professionals to understand the principles and value of data science, and use this to inform business decisions, and recruit and retain the right talent to drive change.1

,

With insights from the UC Berkeley School of Information (I School), the Data Science Essentials online short course aims to equip you with the fundamentals of data science and the requirements for learning from big data. You’ll learn the foundations of data science for business, allowing you to articulate the value this implementation can bring, and apply it for success.

,

what_will_learn: ['The knowledge to make informed decisions regarding data science and its impact on your business|', 'The ability to establish a team capable of delivering results through data science analytics|', 'An understanding of how complex data can be harnessed to grow and scale an organization, and the skills to tackle the challenges associated with leading a data science project|', '', '']
target_students:
While most data science courses focus on the technical skills of becoming a data scientist, the primary focus of this course is the non-technical skills required to understand and make informed decisions on the impact data science can have on your business|
The course is aimed at business leaders who are eager to understand how the field of data science can be harnessed to drive organizational value| Professionals leading a team of analysts or data scientists will benefit from the foundational principles| Senior managers and executives will gain the technical acumen needed to be more effective in strengthening the data science capabilities of their business| For leaders intent on driving a greater data science awareness in business and team collaborations, the iterative nature of the course material will support this application|
instructor|1|designation: Lecturer, Data Scientist, and Consultant, UC Berkeley School of Information
short_description: Harness data to scale your organization and meet your business objectives
additional_pricing_details: You can pay your course fees before the course starts, or you may opt for a split payment plan on courses that are nine weeks and shorter. For courses 10 weeks and longer, there is a three-part payment plan available.

title: Data Visualization With Tableau
description:
[

Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)

Data-driven insights are an increasingly valuable resource across industries. This has accelerated the demand for analytics professionals who can communicate complex data sets in a clear and visual way. The Northwestern Engineering Data Visualization With Tableau online short course provides the tools and insights to communicate data and uncertainty using a leading platform in data visualization and business intelligence.1 Over eight weeks, you’ll explore best practices and techniques grounded in cognitive psychology and graphic design, and learn how to select the right visualization technique to make data easier to understand for stakeholders at all levels. With guidance from expert faculty, you’ll learn to use data storytelling to improve organizational decision-making, while balancing operational goals.

1 Tableau (2021).

,

Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)

,

Data-driven insights are an increasingly valuable resource across industries. This has accelerated the demand for analytics professionals who can communicate complex data sets in a clear and visual way. The Northwestern Engineering Data Visualization With Tableau online short course provides the tools and insights to communicate data and uncertainty using a leading platform in data visualization and business intelligence.1 Over eight weeks, you’ll explore best practices and techniques grounded in cognitive psychology and graphic design, and learn how to select the right visualization technique to make data easier to understand for stakeholders at all levels. With guidance from expert faculty, you’ll learn to use data storytelling to improve organizational decision-making, while balancing operational goals.

,

1 Tableau (2021).

]

target_students: Existing data analysts, business intelligence and functional analysts, and managers who are responsible for making data-driven decisions will find this Northwestern Engineering online short course useful| The content is specifically geared toward those who would like to further their careers in the sought-after field of data visualization| By expanding their practical Tableau skills and learning to effectively present and communicate data to non-technical audiences, data science professionals — whether experienced or new to the world of work — can effectively transmit data in a pictorial or graphical way to help uncover trends and inform decision-making|Please note: Basic data comprehension is required for this course| This includes a familiarity with tabular data (e|g|, using Microsoft Excel) and basic statistical terms (e|g|, mean, median, and mode)|
short_description: Learn to present data effectively using the tools and techniques required for impactful data visualization.
